title: Condition for relation to be symmetric
course: Discrete Mathematics by Prof Sudarshan Iyengar

transcript.text: How do we check whether a given relation  is symmetric or not? You must look at all
possible entries in the matrix and see if the  corresponding entries across the diagonal are
the same or not. Basically, the red zone and  the blue zone, the corresponding entries should
all be the same. So what do I mean by this? Notation-wise all I am saying is the entries
after considering the transpose of the matrix  M should be equal to M Transpose, isn’t it?
